### frameTriviallyRequiresSP() {#a5c1f72ef80dbbf61d84dc5373b18b598}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool frameTriviallyRequiresSP (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo">MachineFrameInfo</a> &amp; MFI)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Returns true if the frame will require a reference to the stack pointer.

This is the set of conditions common to setting up the stack pointer in a kernel, and for using a frame pointer in a callable function.

FIXME: Should also check hasOpaqueSPAdjustment and if any inline asm references SP.

<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The driver will always set the SRD for wave 64 (bits 118:117 of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// descriptor / bits 22:21 of third sub-reg will be 0b11)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the shader is actually wave32 we have to modify the const&#95;index&#95;stride</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// field of the descriptor 3rd sub-reg (bits 22:21) to 0b10 (stride=32). The</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Add the scratch wave offset into the scratch RSRC.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="849"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We only want to update the first 48 bits, which is the base address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="850"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pointer, without touching the adjacent 16 bits of flags. We know this add</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// cannot carry-out from bit 47, otherwise the scratch allocation would be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// impossible to fit in the 48-bit global address space.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: Evaluate if it is better to just construct an SRD using the flat</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// scratch init and some constants rather than update the one we are passed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/mem2reg-cpp/#a6fde3eb6ca09ddf2fd76432176d817bb">Register</a> ScratchRsrcSub0 = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinesink-cpp/#a0f36ed1bc17fc1aa97fe291c439a0698">TRI</a>-&gt;getSubReg(ScratchRsrcReg, AMDGPU::sub0);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/mem2reg-cpp/#a6fde3eb6ca09ddf2fd76432176d817bb">Register</a> ScratchRsrcSub1 = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinesink-cpp/#a0f36ed1bc17fc1aa97fe291c439a0698">TRI</a>-&gt;getSubReg(ScratchRsrcReg, AMDGPU::sub1);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We cannot Kill ScratchWaveOffsetReg here because we allow it to be used in</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1834"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1835"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is essentially a reduced version of hasFP for entry functions. Since the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1836"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// stack pointer is known 0 on entry to kernels, we never really need an FP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1837"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// register. We may need to initialize the stack pointer depending on the frame</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1838"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// properties, which logically overlaps many of the cases where an ordinary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1839"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function would require an FP.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1840"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Also used for chain functions. While not technically entry functions, chain</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1841"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// functions may need to set up a stack pointer in some situations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1842" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/siframelowering/#a572f7d3a80aeaedcf8eec0b7872e6c89"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/siframelowering/#a572f7d3a80aeaedcf8eec0b7872e6c89">SIFrameLowering::requiresStackPointerReference</a>(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1843"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1844"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Callable functions always require a stack pointer reference.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1852"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for callees if there are any. Also note tail calls are impossible/don&#39;t</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1855"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
